name: Hero Pose (Virasana)
description: A seated yoga pose that promotes flexibility, posture, and mindfulness.
equipment: Optional (yoga mat or cushion for support)
instructions: Kneel on the floor with your knees together and feet slightly apart.
Sit back so your hips rest between your heels, keeping your back straight.
Place your hands on your thighs and relax your shoulders.
Close your eyes or soften your gaze, focusing on your breath.
Hold the pose for 1-5 minutes, breathing deeply and maintaining good posture.
To release, gently lift yourself back to a kneeling or seated position.

name: Tree Pose (Vrikshasana)
description: A balancing yoga pose that enhances focus, stability, and inner calm.
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
Shift your weight onto one foot and lift the opposite foot off the ground.
Place the sole of your lifted foot on the inner thigh or calf of the standing leg (avoid the knee).
Bring your hands to a prayer position at your chest or raise them overhead.
Focus on a fixed point to maintain balance and breathe deeply.
Hold for 20-60 seconds, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Triangle Pose (Trikonasana)
description: A standing yoga pose that stretches the legs, spine, and shoulders while improving balance and focus.
instructions: Stand with your feet about 3-4 feet apart, turning one foot outward at a 90-degree angle.
Extend your arms parallel to the floor with palms facing down.
Hinge at your hip and reach toward the extended foot, lowering your hand to your shin, ankle, or the floor.
Extend the other arm straight up toward the ceiling, keeping your chest open.
Gaze at your raised hand or look forward if needed for balance.
Hold for 20-30 seconds, breathing deeply, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Standing Forward Bend (Uttanasana)
description: A calming yoga pose that stretches the hamstrings, calves, and lower back while promoting relaxation.
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
Inhale deeply and lengthen your spine.
Exhale and hinge forward from your hips, lowering your torso toward your legs.
Allow your head to relax, and let your hands rest on the floor, ankles, or shins.
Keep a slight bend in your knees if needed to avoid strain.
Hold for 20-30 seconds, breathing deeply, then slowly rise back to standing.

name: Extended Puppy Pose (Uttana Shishosana)
description: A yoga pose that stretches the spine, shoulders, and chest while promoting relaxation and stress relief.
instructions: Start in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the mat.
Walk your hands forward while keeping your hips aligned above your knees.
Lower your chest towards the ground, resting your forehead on the mat.
Stretch your arms forward with palms pressing into the mat.
Breathe deeply and relax into the stretch, feeling the spine lengthen.
Hold for 20-30 seconds, then slowly return to a tabletop position.

name: Childâ€™s Pose (Balasana)
description: A gentle resting yoga pose that promotes relaxation, stretches the back, and relieves stress.
benefits: stretches the lower back and hips
instructions: Start in a kneeling position with your big toes touching and knees apart.
Sit back onto your heels and extend your arms forward on the mat.
Lower your forehead to the ground and relax your shoulders and back.
Breathe deeply, allowing your body to release tension with each exhale.
Hold for 30 seconds to a few minutes, then slowly return to a seated position.

name: Seated Forward Bend (Paschimottanasana)
description: A calming yoga pose that deeply stretches the spine, hamstrings, and lower back while promoting relaxation.
instructions: Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you.
Inhale and lengthen your spine, sitting up tall.
Exhale and hinge forward from your hips, reaching toward your feet.
Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your spine.
Rest your hands on your shins, ankles, or feet, depending on flexibility.
Hold for 20-30 seconds, breathing deeply, then slowly return to an upright position.

name: Reclining Bound Angle Pose (Supta Baddha Konasana)
description: A restorative yoga pose that gently opens the hips, stretches the inner thighs, and promotes relaxation.
benefits: opens the hips and inner thighs
equipment: Optional (yoga mat, bolster, or blanket for support)
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Bring the soles of your feet together, allowing your knees to drop outward.
Rest your arms at your sides with palms facing up.
Close your eyes and breathe deeply, relaxing your hips and thighs.
Hold the pose for 1-5 minutes, allowing your body to fully relax.
To release, gently bring your knees together and stretch your legs out straight.
